intro: Dichapetalum korupinum, commonly known as the Korup mallow, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of western Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or pink. The plant has large, palmately lobed leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of dense tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
